description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1133413935228973056

> Sounds like the compose button on mobile might be set to append the post you make to whatever feed you're on at the time to make it look like the feed updated, but that's not intended behavior and we'll log this and get it fixed. Thanks for the report

I think we had a similar issue to this on the front so I suspect that Nicks message above is totally correct.

title: Tapping comment notifications results in losing description on post
description:
When you tap a notification for a vote or remind, it correctly displays the post title and description.

When you tap a notification for a comment, it only displays the title with no description.



See video explanation:


![RPReplay_Final1595276472](/uploads/071d8640ce4bf071bb177a75940f9097/RPReplay_Final1595276472.MP4)

title: Update Minds+ Discovery organization to be consistent with regular discovery
description:
Minds+ Discovery should be consistent with regular discovery.

The sections should be:

1. Just for you

This section should be all of the top Minds+ content using same backend as web app. All of the content should be visible and when a non Minds+ member tries to click it, they should be prompted to upgrade.

2. Your tags

This section should just be the users saved tags, same as it is on regular discovery. However, if they are in the context of Minds+, it should only show Minds+ content in the hashtag feed. Under your saved tags, we should be presenting the Suggested hashtag list.

3. Trending

This section should be all of the trending hashtags specifically for Minds+ content. We likely do not have data for this right now, so we can probably hide it until there is real data. @markeharding

title: Hashtags are getting applied to consecutive posts
description:
Steps to replicate:

1. Open composer
2. Make status post
3. Add #art
4. Post it
5. Open composer again
6. Go to make status post again
7. Notice that #art is automatically assigned to the new post. This should be blank for a new post.

title: Never show no results in discovery "For You" section
description:
## Regular Discovery

If a user visits regular Discovery and has no saved tags, copy web logic (screenshot).

![Screen_Shot_2020-07-20_at_1.18.32_PM](/uploads/55f858cac24cdfbfd23e24cadc648481/Screen_Shot_2020-07-20_at_1.18.32_PM.png)

## Minds+ Discovery

If a user visits Minds+ Discovery, they should see all of the top Minds+ content as if they are in Minds+, but whenever they attempt to open the content, we should prompt then to Upgrade to Minds+.

Currently there is another bug where Minds+ discovery is pulling regular content upon refresh. See https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2417

title: Search memory enhancement
description:
Expand the search dropdown which appears upon first click to include channels you have selected from the autocomplete feature.

The autocomplete feature displays channels in the same dropdown region once you start typing based on the characters you are typing.

Currently the only memory that exists within the search dropdown is from full searches (meaning you actually pressed enter). This task calls for remembering BOTH full search queries and selected autocomplete suggestions.

Design: https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231642-navigation/#artboard8

title: Require hashtags for plus submissions
Make the bottom options background opaque and move the camera on top
Portrait Content Feed
description:
## Tasks

- [x] Create a local store to remember videos that have been seen (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2518)
- [x] Send `GET` request to return a list of all portrait videos (https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/1690)
- [x] Filter out videos that have been seen locally (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2518)
- [x] Submit is_portrait of object:video and activity to elasticsearch (https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/1689)
- [x] Ability to filter feed by portrait on the backend (https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/1690)
- [x] Implement a portrait bar component that shows available content
- [x] Implement a portrait content swiper

## Overview

The portrait feed is being used as a means to encourage native content (video and images) via the mobile apps. In essence, this implementation is a pseudo-stories implementation.

Framer Prototype
https://framer.com/share/Portrait-Feed-9BQBZfHLa1fjnokJKiiV

Design Assets
[Spec Export - Sketch Measure 2.4](https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%23-portrait-feed/#artboard1)

Some functionality may be open to change.

## Functionality
* If a user uploads a portrait image or video from the mobile app, it will feature in the portrait content feed, as well as the normal newsfeed.
* The user contributes via the normal composer.
* When a user views a portrait piece of content, it is marked as seen.
* Unseen content will be highlighted within the feed with a yellow stroke
* Portrait content is displayed within the same UI as the full screen swiper, with in the inclusion of a stepper at the top of the image/video.
* Tapping on a channel within the feed will bring the user to the first unseen post belonging to that user.
* The user can access the next post by tapping on the right of the screen
* The user can access the previous post by tapping on the left of the screen.
* Posts are grouped by channel.
* Swiping from right - left will bring the user to the next channel (to the first unseen post).
* Swiping from left-right will bring the user to the previous channel
* Tapping the `+` icons the left of the channel icons will engage the composer
* Only content created within the last 48hrs will be displayed within the portrait content feed.
* When the composer is engaged, the gallery functionality should be removed. The text option from the bottom of the composer should also be removed.


cc @ottman @ottman - you may want to run your eyes over the above points. In particular the 'TBC' items.

title: NSFW Images are black squares in the full screen post viewer
Red notif alert wont go away
description: If you refresh your notifs the red dot wont disappear until you leave and come back

title: Editing post from channel or full screen view deletes the post
description:
If you edit a post on mobile, it deletes the post. Nasty bug.

Steps to replicate:

1. Make a status post on mobile
2. Go to your channel
3. Click to edit the post
4. Make an edit and click Save.
5. You briefly see edited post and it says 50 years ago. Scroll to refresh channel feed. Status post disappears

title: Post titles are not showing up in mobile app
description:
Post titles are not showing up anywhere on mobile app.

To replicate:

View this post on web with a title:

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1122266873826193408

Then go to Jack channel on mobile and look at the same post. The title does not show.

Mobile 4.2 iphone 7

title: Cannot view long status posts inside of composer
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

If you are typing a longer status post, once the text gets past the bottom of the composer window, there is no way to see what you are typing any more. It goes below the screen and there is no scroll activated.

### Steps to reproduce

1. open composer on mobile
2. go to text input
3. type in very long status

### Platform information 

iphone 4.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

see summary

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

scroll should be activated so you can see entire status

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Scroll jump due to boosts in feeds
description:
### Summary
The scroll start to jump and the newsfeed is broken

### Steps to reproduce

The bug seems to happen when the same post is returned from the boosted service and it also exists in the user newsfeed.

### Platform information 

Mobile

### Possible fixes
Clone the Activity model objects in the boosted content service to prevent been overwritten by the entities' service
